hackathon-description-text: The mission of Knight Hacks is to empower students to do something they've never done before. We hope you'll join us!
hackathon-eligibility:
Any college student or college graduate who graduated less than a year ago. The event is open to all students to attend but only students who have registered, confirmed registration, and checked into the event are elligible for prizes.
The maximum amount of people in a prize elligible team is

Knight Hacks abides by the 
.
Knight Hacks is not responsible for illicit or illegal software produced at the event. Knight Hacks does not condone the use of such software for malicious intents, or any other intent other than for educational purposes.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Echo Show brings you everything you love about Alexa, and now she can show you things. Watch video flash briefings, Amazon Video content, see music lyrics, security cameras, photos, weather forecasts, to-do and shopping lists, browse and listen to Audible audiobooks, and more. All hands-free—just ask.
Enhance your home with soft white lighting, controlled remotely wherever you are. Set timers and light schedules, automating your lights to make it seem like someone is home even when you are away.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: 2nd - Philips Hue White Smart Bulb Starter Kit

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: CUSTOMIZATION, CONTROL AND READY TO GAME

$50 Amazon Giftcards - Sonobi is a data driven ad technology company that builds innovative solutions that bring addressability, quality, and scale to the business of advertising. They are offering a data prize for the most creative use of data they are providing at

Amazon Web Services - Best Use of AWS
Best IoT Hack Using a Qualcomm Device

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=12760 Pegasus Dr, Orlando, FL 32816, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Teams that submit projects that they come up with themselves have a better chance of winning!
Judges should check to make sure submissions have solid code backing them, rather than just being a proof of concept demonstration.
